snippet: A state-level court had banned santhara, considered essential to followers of the Jain religion, ruling that it was tantamount to suicide, which is illegal in India.
abstract: Indian state of Rajasthan's ban on santhara, fatal fast practiced by Jains, effected in early August, is suspended by India's Supreme Court; state court considers practice performed primarily by old and infirm to be suicide, upsetting Jain activists.
lead_paragraph: A state-level court had banned santhara, considered essential to followers of the Jain religion, ruling that it was tantamount to suicide, which is illegal in India.

headline.main: India’s Supreme Court Suspends Ban on Starvation Ritual
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; India: Ban on Fatal Fasting Is Suspended
